snippet: I’ll Have Another had physical problems well before he was withdrawn from the Belmont Stakes on the eve of the race, according to veterinary records.
abstract: Veterinary records show that I'll Have Another, the horse that almost became the first Triple Crown winner in 34 years, had physical ailments well before he was withdrawn from the Belmont Stakes on the eve of the race, and was being treated with painkillers and anti-inflammatory drugs; racing authorities are concerned that painkillers are being increasingly employed by trainers to keep unsound horses racing in pursuit of larger purses.

byline.original: By JOE DRAPE and WALT BOGDANICH

lead_paragraph: I’ll Have Another had physical problems well before he was withdrawn from the Belmont Stakes on the eve of the race, according to veterinary records.

headline.seo: I’ll Have Another Had History of Ailments, Records Show
headline.main: Records Show Triple Crown Contender Had History of Ailments
headline.print_headline: Records Show Triple Crown Contender Had History of Ailments
